definition: to lose one's splendor/to lose luster/to be eclipsed/to be overshadowed

sentences.english: Eventually, the original business was eclipsed by the other holdings.
sentences.chinese: 最终，最初的这家公司与其它财产相比黯然失色。

sentences.english: He seemed to relish the pressure and focus that had eclipsed his predecessors.
sentences.chinese: 安帅对压力和聚焦的把握能力让他的前任黯然失色。

sentences.english: The huge brick house which Banker White had built on Buckey Street had overshadowed it.
sentences.chinese: 银行家怀特在白克埃街上建的大砖屋，使它黯然失色。

sentences.english: You, you look really CSL, even goddesses in front of you must fade.
sentences.chinese: 幽先生，您长得真俊，连女神在您面前都要黯然失色。

sentences.english: In his eyes she eclipses and predominates the whole of her sex.
sentences.chinese: 在他的眼里，她卓然不凡，使其他女性黯然失色。

sentences.english: Even the David Cameron and Nick Clegg travelling roadshow has lost its zest.
sentences.chinese: 即便是卡梅隆和克莱格的巡回演说，也黯然失色了。

sentences.english: Then the minister came, and in that overshadowing presence the lesser lights went into eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 接着牧师到了，他的华丽的在场令灯光也黯然失色。

sentences.english: She is quite eclipsed by her clever younger sister.
sentences.chinese: 在聪明的姐姐相形之下，她变得黯然失色。

sentences.english: But the brand was getting tarnished.
sentences.chinese: 但是这却使柏加的品牌形象黯然失色了。

sentences.english: She is quite eclipsed by her clever sister.
sentences.chinese: 在聪明的姐姐相形之下，她变得黯然失色。

sentences.english: The virtue of theman elided with his words.
sentences.chinese: 此人的美德让他的言词黯然失色。

sentences.english: The play now seems to eclipse the work.
sentences.chinese: 现在，娱乐看起来使得工作黯然失色。

sentences.english: Her dress paled before that of her hostess.
sentences.chinese: 她的衣裙与女主人的相比显得黯然失色。

sentences.english: In the run-up to the inauguration, Mr Medvedev has been far less visible than Mr Putin.
sentences.chinese: 在竞选的冲刺中，梅德韦德夫与普京相比，黯然失色。

sentences.english: That shames the splendour of a million moons.
sentences.chinese: 无数个月亮也黯然失色。

sentences.english: Yet the doves are soon eclipsed in his book by Roosevelt.
sentences.chinese: 不过在书中，罗斯福很快让鸽派人士黯然失色。

definition: to feel ashamed of one's inferiority (idiom)/to feel inferior
to enhance by contrast/to set off/to serve as a background in order to bring out the subject with greater brilliance/to serve as a prop/a foil
lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
inferior (often in the combination 毫無遜色|毫无逊色, not in the least inferior)
